application.name: crop
application.description: This program can be used to crop or select a sub-area from a cube. The user can select to crop in any or all dimensions: sample, line, and band. The crop parameter selection requires that the area of interest be contiguous. That is, the program will not allow non-continuous cropping such as lines 1-5, 10-30, and 80-100.

history.change: Removed crop from the Utility category
Added red rectangle to input image of example to illustrate crop area.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: The cube which will be cropped.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: The smaller output cube containing the results of the crop.

parameter.name: SAMPLE
parameter.description: The starting sample to extract. It must be inside the cube.

parameter.name: LINE
parameter.description: The starting line to extract. It must be inside the cube.

parameter.name: BAND
parameter.description: The starting band to extract. It must be inside the cube.

parameter.name: NSAMPLES
parameter.description: The number of samples to extract. It must stay inside the input cube.

parameter.name: NLINES
parameter.description: The number of lines to extract. It must stay inside the input cube.

parameter.name: NBANDS
parameter.description: The number of bands to extract. It must stay inside the input cube.

terminalInterface.commandLine: f=peaks.cub t=crop.cub samp=100 line=200 band=1 nsamp=200 nline=300 nbands=1
terminalInterface.description: In this example crop will extract a 200x300 sub-area that starts at sample 100 and line 200
